data: VASC Endovascular Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Repair - Post Operative (Multiphase)
Nurse to Initiate Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the Inpatient Unit
Discontinue VASC Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
Assess neurovascular status lower extremity, q1h for 4 hour, then q4h for 24 hour, then QID if satisfactory
q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hour then BID. Start on arrival to recovery room
Bilateral pedal pulse assessment q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hour then BID. Start on arrival to recovery room
q1h, until 0600 post-op day 1, then q6h if stable
To straight drainage (urometer) if foley placed in OR
Site: Surgical Site, Reinforce PRN, Leave dressing on for 48 hours unless otherwise directed
Site: Surgical Site, Reinforce PRN, Leave dressing on for 48 hours unless otherwise directed
for 6 hour, Activity as Tolerated 6 hours post operative
for 24 hour, Activity as Tolerated 24 hours post operative
Use 110 kg weight for patients weighing greater than 110 kg
order rate: 2 mL/kg/h, IV, order duration: 6 hour, drug form: bag

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with history of allergy to penicillins including anaphylaxis EXCEPT in those with severe delayed skin reactions - e.g. Stevens-Johnson Syndrome (SJS), toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN), DRESS
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
2,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
If ceFAZolin allergic, severe delayed skin reactions to penicillins (e.g. SJS, TEN, DRESS), contraindicated or MRSA positive
1,000 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 24 hour
1,500 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 24 hour
For HIGH RISK patients (groin surgery in diabetics; morbidly obese; re-operative procedures; active peripheral infection; gangrene of either limb), ADD:
500 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
500 mg, PO, q12h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: tab
1.5 mg/kg, IV, q8h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: inj
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
q1h until 0600 post-op day1, then q4h if stable for 24 hour, then vitals QID when stable
Measure O2 saturation q1h overnight, then q4h x 24 hours, then QID
T+2;N, Change groin incision dressings unless otherwise ordered
Dressing must be changed prior to discharge
T;N+360, Activity as Tolerated 6 hours post operative
T;N+1440, Activity as Tolerated 24 hours post operative
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
T;N, May have ice chips and clear fluids as tolerated
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Complete the VASC Post Operative Pain and Symptom Management PowerPlan (if POPS not involved)
81 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab-EC, start: T+1
75 mg, PO, qdaly, drug form: tab, start: T+1
3.75 mg, PO, qHS, PRN insomnia, drug form: tab
3 mg, sublingual, qHS, PRN insomnia, drug form: tab-sublingual
6 mg, sublingual, qHS, PRN insomnia, drug form: tab-sublingual
9 mg, sublingual, qHS, PRN insomnia, drug form: tab-sublingual
Insulin Subcutaneous for Patients Eating or NPO (Sliding Scale) (Module)
Insulin Subcutaneous for Patients on TPN or Continuous Enteral Feeds (Sliding Scale) (Module)
For eGFR less than 30 mL/min, select Bowel Protocol - Renal (Module)
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, q2day for 2 doses or times
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, q3day for 6 doses or times
Electrolytes Panel (Na, K, Cl, CO2, Anion Gap)
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, q2day for 2 doses or times
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, q2day for 2 doses or times
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 94% or greater
Consider Consultation with Anesthesia, Hematology, Endocrinology and Psychiatry

Reason for Consult: Other (see special instructions)
